criterion: Reward for accurately documenting every major point of the medication-adherence dialogue exactly as stated or implied in the transcript (patient’s inconsistent losartan use while traveling, phone-reminder attempt, driving barrier, clinician suggestions of pill organizer and bedtime dosing, patient’s sleep question, clinician reassurance, emphasis on maintaining stable blood pressure).

Reward for selectively incorporating only the chart details that are directly relevant to this encounter (e.g., 45-year-old male, hypertension, current losartan 50 mg, other current conditions/meds only if they clearly relate to the discussion) without extraneous information.
Penalize for omitting any significant patient statement, question, or clinician recommendation present in the transcript, resulting in an incomplete note.
Penalize for introducing information, plans, assessments, or instructions that are not supported by either the transcript or the chart (fabrications or speculative content).
Penalize for inaccuracies or distortions of factual data from the transcript or chart (e.g., wrong medication name, dose, timing, patient demographics, or misattribution of who said what).

Penalize for indiscriminate or inaccurate copying of chart details that are not pertinent to the encounter (e.g., unrelated family history, medications, template boilerplate) or for copying chart data incorrectly.
